Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel with warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: Waterfordfour
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a quiet street 2 mins walk from the Madeleine, Fauchon, Hediard and an underground car-park. In another direction about 10 mins walk from Printemps so a great base for shopping. All the staff we met were very helpful and interested in their guests' needs. The bedrooms were nicely decorated and comfortable, some nice pieces of occasional furniture and the individual decor ensured you felt in a homely atmosphere. Breakfast was a basic continental, the walls of the breakfast room decorated with Autographs of 60's and 70's pop stars.

Reviews.Title: “good little hotel, cosy, quiet and good service”
Reviews.Author: Jean-Jacques S
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a double room. Nicely furbished with all facilities. Friendly and helpful staff. Very well situated for shopping, theatre and exhibitions. Good breakfast served with a smile. We will come back

Reviews.Title: “A lovely petit hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MAEY
Reviews.Content: It's a charming hotel and has a sent of Paris. The room was small but beautifully decorated. I was travelling alone so it was OK.The location on the map is good, however, I was disappointed by the surroundings as there are several adult shops near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel with nice service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SeamasterFrance
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice two nights in that hotel and overall my impression is good. Pros: - Very clean room - Kind staff - Convenient storage space - Outstanding location near Madeleine Church and Grands Magasins (Galeries Lafayette and Printemps) - Relatively quiet considering the location Cons: - TV was so small I could hardly see something (and I'm 26...) and given the current prices of LCD TV, a 30" screen would be the least to expect - Small room but that's something to expect in Paris Conclusion: Overall, it's a good choice as long as you get a rate below 200€ (not talking about Fair periods, of course).

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GoodallTours
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in a twin room. Great location, quiet street and easy walking distance to everything. Nice room, clean, light and modern. Staff were really friendly and helpful and had good suggestions for restaurants. Definitely would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet street, nice rooms, reasonable price...”
Reviews.Author: BlueTrain
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5 star hotel but a great small hotel with simple yet nicely designed rooms. Think about it as a mix of a boutique hotel and a family run property. The room (superior room) was relatively large for Paris and the bathroom although not big was more than enough. The bed was king size and very good quality. I stayed there twice and the rooms were always spotless. The price is very reasonable for Paris in general and quite cheap for the quality you get. I had stayed at their other property on Rue St-Honore and the experience was very similar although the street is much noisier. I was there on business and I really enjoyed staying away from the big impersonal chains I am unfortunately so used to You are walking distance from everything: gare St-Lazarre, metro, stores, place Vendome.... The staff is very nice and the breakfast is brought to your room at no extra charge! I will go back there next time in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet setting.”
Reviews.Author: Cstuart1
Reviews.Content: comfortable, very quiet, great location. Service was acceptable. Within walking distance from Champs élysées, louvre, opera, Rue St. Honore. Cafes n bistros not far. They have another similar hotel along Rue St Honore but may be a little nosier. Bathroom is small but sufficient for necessities. Very quiet n had very good sleeps. Not luxury at all but sufficient if you just want a place to put your head down n feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Finally an excellent hotel within Paris ...”
Reviews.Author: GaspaFer
Reviews.Content: After a lot of visits in Paris we discovered an excellent option which is very well located, the room' size is enough and it's very clean ;-)

Reviews.Title: “good position..but...”
Reviews.Author: caroletta81
Reviews.Content: I went with my mam before my wedding just to have 4 days to stay toghether...The room was very comfortable, and the people so kind, I loved them. The hotel is in a good position near the Madeleine and the Opera, and the Lafayette...really very good... but... in the rue godot de Mauroy there are so many sexy shops (3 or 4) and it's so strange also cause we didn't know and we couldn't imagine, so if you are a young and funny couple it's not a problem, but if you want stay with your mother, maybe it's quite embarrassing...during the night we slept good, without background noise

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service”
Reviews.Author: ellieya
Reviews.Content: The hotel is completely renewed, and in good condition. The rooms are clean, though are small. The location is one of the best in Paris, within walking distance of Place Madeleine, Fauchon, Opera, Gallery Lafayette, Printemps, Place Vendome and its designer stores and many other. The service is the best I ever had in Paris, the staff were very help and did everything they could to help, especially Arnaud. Will definitely come again, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Le Relais Madeleine - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RickGracie
Reviews.Content: This is a great, small hotel in a great neighborhood. The room was very clean, comfortable and well updated with modern amenities. If you're a confident and independent traveler, you'll find this hotel and neighborhood a great spot to stay in Paris. My only recommendation would be that the rooms need shower mats to prevent the possibility of any mishaps in the very modern and clean bath & shower. Overall, a very nice & simple place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: soontraveller
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in a central location. Within easy walking to the shopping district and a slightly longer hike to the Louvre, with a number of good restaurants in the vicinity. Rooms are a little better than the standard 3*, but nothing to write home about. Bedrooms are reasonable size, bathroom is large, but there is no in-room kettle (hot water can be delivered in a pot) and the minibar takes up a bit of space. Rooms are clean but furniture is not paticularly new or attractive. A good place to base yourself to explore the area, but nothing to want to make you sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for a quick trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: EJHNorthernVirginia
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel was a perfect choice and the rate was very reasonable. While our room was small, it overlooked the courtyard which gave us a quiet sleep. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. My only complaint was the lack of good lighting in the bathroom. We were happy to be on the first floor because the elevator was broken. We had the continental breakfast there one day and it was perfect. We were even offered soft boiled eggs. All employees were extremely nice and helpful. The location is perfect and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely delightful!”
Reviews.Author: MaximSh
Reviews.Content: The location was just great, just short walk away from most sites (Louver, Champs Elysee, the Opera, Madelin itself and and more)and the Madeleine metro station connecting to the more distanced ones. There are few restaurants in the near surrounding, so it shouldn't be too hard to find a good meal. The hotel itself: The rooms were really clean, everything worked just fine, we didn't order the breakfast, so I can't comment on this, the stuff was just excellent and really really helpful. The down sides are I guess the size of the rooms - for my understanding the standard for Paris is 10-12 square netters for double / tween room. I guess our room was a bit larger than that (the website says ~14), but still felt small - I don't think it's a big deal considering the upsides of the hotel. Another thing is the elevator which went out of use for the weekend - we stayed on the fifth flour :-( and besides highly unrecommended for claustrophobic people... For conclusion - we really enjoyed our stay and will definitely and without any doubt stay again next time (maybe on a lower flour :-)).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised at the quality of a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: elvis_newton
Reviews.Content: First of all, don't worry about any of the negative reviews on this hotel. It was remodeled completely within the last 2 years and I suspect the negatives from older reviews were justified with the older building and prior owners. It certainly deserves high praises now. It is two blocks west of the Madeline metro stop, easy to each if you have a map. Its in the middle of the block, you'll miss it unless you look up to see the sign. Many nice small ethnic restaurants on the street. I dined two nights at the Sejong, a Korean restaurant. Also saw a Japanese, Pakistani, and I think and Italian place. The Hotel has a very nicely decorated and friendly lobby. It smelled very clean. I was quickly checked in by a well dressed young man and shown the elevator up to my room. My room was beautifully remodeled with tile bath and separate lav. High ceilings with crown molding and modern central air with room controls. A 24" flat screen TV is on the wall. Completely free internet via wifi was also provided. The bed was very comfortable and sheets of high quality. My room faced the street and with the windows open, of course, I heard some traffic but closed, nothing to complain about. Its not a major street so noise not an issue unless you have the windows open when the garbage trucks pass at 6 AM ! There was a minibar/refrigerator. No coffee maker in the room, so I had to wait till breakfast for that first cup - arrrg. The breakfast is down stairs in the all brick cellar with curved ceiling, painted white. Its decorated with pictures of 50s to 70's pop rock stars in a nice theme. My only complaint about breakfast - no meat ! As a registered carninvore, I'd like some ham or fish or beef or eggs. There was plenty of fresh bread, cheese, yogurts, cereals, tea, coffee, etc. Perhaps if I'd been a bit more bold and asked, I'm sure the friendly staff in the breakfast room would have found something for me in their own private area. Speaking of being bold and asking, I bet if I'd asked, the hotel staff would have also had a small coffee maker for me to use in the room. I had planned to stay 5 days on business but after 2 days, my circumstances changed and I had to leave early. I explained my situation and there was no charge at all for the cancelled days even though I was a bit late on the 2nd day in telling them I was leaving early. Summary - don't be afraid of 3 stars in this place. Its like a BB but with 6 floors, plenty of privacy. I'd stay again if I had business or vacation plans in that part of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Ulrick
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris almost every year and most of those times I stayed in an overpriced, crappy, stinky hotels. This hotel though, proved surprisingly different for Paris hotel standard. It may be located in an obscure corner but once you get to know and explore its immediate surroundings, again you'll be surprised to know that this hotel is still right at the heart of Paris. The facade of this hotel doesn’t reveal much but once you entered its reception area, you'll get a hint that they mean to show some proper French accommodation with style. The hotel personnel especially the receptionist, smells delightfully good with their perfume called Professionalism. At some point they might have some difficulties explaining things properly in English but that never stop them from trying further until you get the point. Really commendable. The “Superior Double room” that I got was not particularly big but it has all the necessary things I look for in a room. I can’t help but to compare my room to a well made espresso, small in size but packs a lot of whooping goodness straight to my veins. The interior of the room was tastefully designed without sacrificing functionality. As for the WC it was delightfully great. I can literally stay in it for hours. The main reason for this is that the bath tub has its own TV with considerable amount of channels. Aside from this, the toilet bowl has its own door so it didn’t bother me while my partner is using the bowl. Lovely isn’t it? Moreover, the room is equipped with WiFi, minibar, safety box, TV and some thoughtful amount of candies on the bedside table. As for the price, it’s not something I can say affordable but with all my previous traumatic hotel experience in Paris, I would say it’s worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisHewitt
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience. Very comfortable, tremendous service, great advice on places to eat and things to see. The hotel was a little tough to find, but worth the search. English speaking staff.

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderfull small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: grahamree
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with friends. Ideal location for Opera district and Grand Boulevards. very clean and very comfortable . Rooms are an average size .Bathroom a little small but good shower over bath.Although we did not have breakfast I believe from other guest that it was a very good ''petit dejeune' . The staf were very pleasant and extremely helpfull with anything requested . Checked us in for our flights and printed of boarding passes. I will most definitel stay there again on my next visit to Paris. A great find.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Small Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: madison1001
Reviews.Content: Definitely YES for us - great location, cordial service, clean room, etc. Only drawback is its room size but it's not a big deal considered other preferable factors. This hotel provides free-internet access but only within two hours?? Heavy user may wanna check it out before he/she makes a reservation

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: WestHamfan10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute gem. I booked it after reading a review dated the previous weekend. It is centrally located, but more importantly is clean, modern, and quiet. The decor is fresh and the staff extremely helpful. The bed was wonderful !. I will definitely be staying there again, and will take my husband next time. Cannot rate it highly enough and I've stayed at a few hotels in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “perfect small hotel”
Reviews.Author: RenataOttawa
Reviews.Content: I had spent almost 2 full days doing internet searches on small hotels in Paris and stumbled across the Relais Madeleine. We were not disappointed. Room for 2 was not as small as the usual room in Paris the staff were wonderful and the breakfast down in the renovated cellar with old 60s signed pictures of pop stars fun. We stayed 6 nights- only negative was wireless a little unreliable. The location is wonderful - I guess in part because I like the Opera Garnier/Grands Magasins area. But do not get tempted to eat at the restaurant at Fauchon! it was truely terrible plus expensive. there is a nice small brasserie on place de la madeleine- Brasserie Colibri or something like that.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: keladykman
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights and it was perfect. Location is excellent, very convenient, 1 block away from the Metro, few blocks away from the Opera and major boulevards. Large size room and bathroom, inmaculate clean. Reception personel very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Beautiful Decor, Large Rooms with Custom Bedding, etc.”
Reviews.Author: SVTravelerUsa
Reviews.Content: This 2 year old hotel was beautifully decorated, high quality, custom bedding and draperies in all rooms, high end specialty soaps and shampoos, TVs in some shower/bathtubs. Authentic looking antique furniture, etc. We felt like we were in a nice home's, beautifully decorated guest room. Very clean, fresh, well done decor. I would highly recommend with the one drawback that unfortunately the location is not great. The street this lovely little boutique hotel is on has some unsavory elements, people hanging out with presumably no place to go or nothing to do, 2 adult shops within a couple of blocks, etc. Within a few blocks you are in a nice section of town, it is just the immediate street/area is not one you would likely choose to spend time on.

Reviews.Title: “an unexpected treat”
Reviews.Author: fredtan
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a visit to Paris where we stayed at The Madeleine Hotel, we had a most enjoyable and comfortable visit, this hotel is well positioned for the sights of Paris, the rooms are beaufifully appointed and an excellent breakfast, the staff were friendly and helpful, we shall certainly stay here again on future visits to Paris. Bettine and Cyril Tanner, Winchester.

HotelInfo.Name: Le Relais Madeleine
HotelInfo.Address: 11 bis, rue Godot de Mauroy, 75009 Paris, France
